result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M. Birkhofer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Theft by Acquisition, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Unpaid Restitution - Civil Judgment - Reduced by any payment made since restitution order.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Concurrent with: Any existing period of supervision.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $209.81 is to be repaid in increments of not less than $50.00 per month, commencing November 1, 2014.    In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Court will leave at the discretion of the Supervising Agent any allowable contact with the victim, D. Bautzmann.  Any contact is solely deferred to the Supervising Agent's discretion.
Defendant to comply with any further terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin M. Birkhofer

ADDRESS INFO for Kevin M. Birkhofer

Letter from DE asking court for sentence to be lifted, reply from judge if he pays $400 lift sentence then chagne to $100 per mth payment.

Case Called @ 9:00 AM: Defendant Kevin M. Birkhofer in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  INFO Stated - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per Atty Groh - matter resolved and requests matter proceed to P/S today.  Agreement recited by DA.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Meds serving no impairment on proceeding today.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1:  NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.  Argument by Atty Groh as to no contact requirement - contact is appropriate, Agent had previously approved contact. Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  5 mos I/S - consecutive to any existing SEH at the time any Revocation may occur (GT, No TS, Huber if Revoked) -  S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  Restitution of $209.81 payments are to made in increments of not less than $50 per month commencing 11/1/14; In the event of revocation any remaining Restitution be converted to civil judgment; contact with victim as authorized by supervising agent - contact solely deferred to agent recommendation; any other terms as deemed appropriate,  Waushara supervision is concurrent to any other supervision currently serving, any revocation will be consecutive to any existing sentence however; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given.

Case Called @ 2:09 PM: Defendant Kevin M. Birkhofer in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Atty Groh has discussed offer rec'd from the State and offer extended recited for the record.  Based upon that offer, Def has decided to waive pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Def confirms his counsel's recital.  Court entertains colloquy as to waiver of pre-lim hearing and State's offer.  Def understands consequences for failure to abide by waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Def BOT.  ARGN/Plea & Sentencing Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Arraignment scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on August 26, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department. Not to be in possession of a credit card and/or debit card or any financial instrument to transfer money.

11:06 am case called. Defendant Kevin M. Birkhofer in court with Attorney Jonathan T. Groh.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Court refers defendant to SPD for appointment of counsel. Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
